Name: Forking Paths Among the Stars
QuestDesc: The newly planted flowers in the Greenhouse have bloomed. Go take a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha, you're finally here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been a while, my sweet seed of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you here for the flowers? Perfect timing. They're about to bloom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Consultants roam all across Solaris, and when they return, they always bring rare flower seeds as souvenirs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nah-uh, I just enjoy planting them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watching them grow, waiting for them to bloom—you know, waiting makes the fruits so much sweeter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, I have my own special seed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every day, I'm consumed by the urge to see it thrive, trembling with excitement for its bloom, the soft touch of petals unfolding in my palm... This feeling… I can't wait to make it mine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, it's the best thing ever to watch and protect it as its breeder.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just a little fun of mine. Well, how's it going, {PlayerName}? Enjoying your time here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard you got the Shorekeeper and all of us out of a huge mess, huh?

Options.PlotLineKey: If I remember correctly, you weren't here back then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, I expected as much. You've shown great potential since you arrived in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... I'm a Bloom Bearer, and a Bloom Bearer knows what they want to know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, you're a sharp one. Yes, I had something else going on, couldn't say hi to you first. What a pity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't know the Shorekeeper would entrust a newcomer with such important tasks... She trusts you. A lot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are…

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}. It's Beatrice. Remember me from the Error Cell?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hate to ask, but could you come back to the Error Cell?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've run into some trouble, and honestly, you're the only one the Shorekeeper trusts to handle it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll explain everything when you get here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks a lot! And don't worry, there'll be a reward for you.

Options.PlotLineKey: Duty calls. I have to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Oh, congratulations, {Male=Mr.;Female=Ms.} Popularity!" Whatever…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only you could be mine… I'd root you in my garden, where only I could savor your sweet, robust vitality… Hehe, just kidding. Hope you don't mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …How strange.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've felt this way before…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You encounter Camellya at the Black Shores' Greenhouse. As usual, she appears nonchalant but pleased nevertheless to chat. Your conversation is interrupted by Beatrice, who needs you to handle a problem at the Error Cell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, there you are! It's been a while, and you still look great.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you came to the Black Shores, so many unexpected things have happened… Even the Shorekeeper made an appearance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, let's get to the point. Do you remember what the Error Cell is for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, your memory is as sharp as ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's basically a "prison" for containing hazardous waste like corrupted Stellar Matrices.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The problem is, one of the "prisoners" has escaped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's headed towards the Necrostar and seems to be trying to go even deeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Shorekeeper is tied up with modulation and can't leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I need your help to recapture it and prevent any more incidents. You're the best person for the job.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I'll make it worth your time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The escapee is hiding, but we can use the remnants of its data to track it down.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (…I think I heard something.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While investigating, I discovered that a few years ago, a Consultant accessed these data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was out in the field recently and just returned to the Black Shores. You should check in with her first.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright. I'll call if I get anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'm counting on you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A corrupted Stellar Matrix has escaped and could endanger the Black Shores. To retrieve it, you seek out the Consultant who previously accessed the Matrix's data.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, you must be {PlayerName}, right? Beatrice filled me in on what happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The reason I looked into that Stellar Matrix is because of this little guy I found in the wild.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A small, damaged, and slightly old-looking robot quietly rests at her feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I found it, it had been non-functional for a long time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tried to fix it, but I couldn't salvage much data… I only got this damaged recording:

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …May: Majority of buildings in Petalfall Village damaged from Tacet Discord invasion. Heavy casualties. Survivors have been transferred…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Threat level extremely high according to the Tethys System. The Black Shores leader has decided to handle the issue {Male=himself;Female=herself} and has departed to…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Static)… The village's remaining structures covered by highly mutated plants. Rescuing is difficult. More time needed…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A… (static)… was discovered in a deep underground cave. One Overclocked Resonator named 'Lady Flora' was rescued and taken to Black Shores. Biography pending...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rabelle's Curve, this subject tends to enter the Overclocking state… currently stable… (static)…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Black Shores leader handled the issue {Male=himself;Female=herself}… So I brought this Lady Flora back to the Black Shores?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The recording ends there. I had just joined the Black Shores back then, feeling curious about everything… especially about our leader.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything about {Male=him;Female=her} was shrouded in mystery, and only a select few had ever met {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I didn't give up. I started looking into the other name mentioned in the recording: Lady Flora.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Stellar Matrix you're hunting down contained information about Lady Flora.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But… I found nothing. Someone deliberately erased the data, and I'm locked out from any remaining traces.

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone wiped everything about Lady Flora…

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. That piqued my interest, so I asked—well, pestered—my seniors to see if I could get anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Flora was said to be very close to the Black Shores leader. They were inseparable and carried out many missions together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, Lady Flora has been missing for nearly two decades…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Missing… Seems like I can't use this clue to locate that matrix.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not necessarily. You're a trusted Bloom Bearer of the Shorekeeper, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Hall of Foreign Affairs stores a lot of information about the Black Shores personnel. Try your luck there. Maybe you'll find something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Consultant reveals the data was intentionally erased, but it involves the leader of the Black Shores—your past self—and a Bloom Bearer named Lady Flora. You learn that you once saved Lady Flora from Petalfall Village and shared a deep bond, but she vanished twenty years ago.

Chapters.Title: Head to the Hall of Foreign Affairs

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, {PlayerName}, what brings you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? But Lady Flora's item was already picked up by another Bloom Bearer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who took it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You looking for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, if you want it, try to catch me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the Hall of Foreign Affairs, you discover that Camellya has already taken Lady Flora's belongings. Now, you must find Camellya.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something's on the ground? I need to check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another camellia... She's never tired of these little games.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess I have no choice but to catch up with Camellya first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're quick! I knew you wouldn't keep me waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Were you following me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, is that a problem?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I followed you to the cell on a whim. Then I heard something interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus, this thing is just finding its way back to its owner. I see no wrong in that.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To its owner… Are you that "Lady Flora"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes and no.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like you, I've completely forgotten about the past! All of it! So, I guess I'm not the Lady Flora you're looking for.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then how did you know you're Lady Flora?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, I did some digging, but… a little accident stopped me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If Camellya is Lady Flora, then we were supposed to be close, but neither of us remembers…)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The fact that I used to be the leader... This should only be known to the Shorekeeper.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Maybe I shouldn't mention it to Camellya until I'm sure she's not a threat.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, if you want to use that trinket to find the problematic matrix, then play with me! Entertain me, and I'll help you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well… Then I'll take this and make a run for it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can try to catch me, but be warned, it won't be an easy chase. Or, you could play along and maybe I'll let you have it. It'll be more fun that way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you handled the Threnodian, a little game of battle shouldn't be too much trouble for you, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a Bloom Bearer, I need to pick the perfect seeds for the Black Shores and give them my utmost care.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All these years, I haven't met anyone intriguing—not one person!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're MY seed of fate. If I let you go so easily, all my efforts, my yearning, my hunger will not be satisfied.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you get taken or killed by somebody else...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I would be very, very, very unhappy.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you so obsessed with me?
Why do you call me your seed of fate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? It's pure instinct!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Flowers thirst for water; beasts hunger for flesh. It's nature, just like my craving for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want it, and I get it. That's how I live.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That fleeing Stellar Matrix might affect the Necrostar’s functioning. Worse, it could threaten the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So? I don't care! If this island's gonna blow up, so be it. Unless, of course, it ruins my fun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you angry? Hehe, your anger is sooo delicious…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fight me. I can't wait to see who'll be the winner. I've been itching to get a taste of your blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahahaha! Fantastic! Let's get started!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After catching up with Camellya, she reveals that she is Lady Flora, but like you, she has lost her memories. She appears indifferent to everything except you and proposes a game in exchange for handing over Flora's items.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While you were handling the troubles at the Black Shores, I was stuck in a medical pod and missed the whole show.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a pity I couldn't witness it in person… Show me. Your blade, your strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, you should always stay focused in a game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The fresh, pulsating despair from my enemies is always delightful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a show. You never disappoint me. With you around, the days ahead will be so much fun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The game's over. Here you go, the thing I promised you. Let's keep going, my hero~

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The info in that matrix is related to you. With you by my side, I should be able to locate and capture it faster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, alright. So...?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to solve this accident as soon as possible, and you promised to help if I played the game with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha! Guess I have no other choice, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Well, it's lovely to see you being a little pushy too! I like your serious side. Sure, I'll go.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What else do you know about Lady Flora? You said a small accident happened during your investigation...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, ended up stuck in a boring medical pod for half a month and almost died from severe Overclocking.

Options.PlotLineKey: You call that a small accident?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, it's no big deal, since I survived.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... My memories were sealed by Lady Flora somehow. No matter how much I try to recall, it doesn't work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only remember waking up in a cave, my mind completely blank. Drifted aimlessly for years, until I stumbled upon the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And guess what? Turns out I had lived here before! Naturally, I wanted to investigate further and figure it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that's what I did. I'm sure I uncovered the truth behind my memory loss, but… when I woke up in the medical pod again, I'd forgotten everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess somehow I almost died from Overclocking when I learned about my past, and I had to seal my memories away again. That's pretty much what happened, I think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still don't know why Lady Flora did that though... Well, I don't really care. I can have fun with or without those memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It doesn't sound like you're talking about your past self.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello~? Are you listening? Told you I remember nothing, so... Lady Flora is more like a stranger to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's like watching a movie. No matter how happy or sad the story is, it's someone else's story, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you feel the same? Tell me, what was on your mind when you witnessed those stories, staring at every frame on the screen?

Options.PlotLineKey: ...I had too many things to think about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, you don't care, do you? I knew we think alike.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww... You are more sentimental than I expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'll trust my instincts over some distant memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as my instincts remain, I'm still "me."

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds a bit too animalistic…
So you let your instincts define what's truly "you"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, and what's wrong with that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My instincts rule me, and I rule them. I feel great joy when they are fulfilled, and when I ignore them, I suffer in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They guide me like how duty and responsiblity guides you... Who says one is better than the other?

Options.PlotLineKey: No, there is no difference between these two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, let's drop this boring discussion. Shall we split up to find the other stuff?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure. Whoever finds it first will go meet up with the other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh, then it's a competition—I'm in! Let the search begin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya enjoyed the game and gives you the bracelet as promised. Recognizing that her help is vital to resolving the current crisis, you ask her to stay. Camellya finds your assertiveness intriguing and agrees to help. In a discussion about self and her lost memories, Camellya claims her instincts define who she is. To gather more of Lady Flora's items, you decide to split up.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Blake Bloom is…

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You continue searching and find a forsaken Blake Bloom in a cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=He's;Female=She's} sooo slow. Hehe, looks like I'm gonna win.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I can sense my prey deep inside. So many of them…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How wonderful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pathetic! Get out of my way, you weaklings!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, finally, something that gets my blood pumping.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Found you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, good. Please me! Delight me! Entertain me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh yes, that's what I want! Keep struggling! MORE!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... Wonderful…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The way you fought really makes my heart race… Such power, such vitality…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, I wish I were the one dancing this deadly, bloody, beautiful waltz with you…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I wanted to help you up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, I know. I was just overwhelmed with joy… Cough! Ugh…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're on the edge of Overclocking. And you were in a medical pod before... Does this happen often?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. Oh, are you worried about me?

Options.PlotLineKey: …I'm just worried that you might endanger the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, you're sooo sweet. I'm almost blushing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's not considerate, darling. Besides, with the Tethys System here, I can't really cause any major damage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I'm good at dancing on the edge. I won't let myself Overclock that easily. But if it does happen… I'll just accept it as my fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's very dangerous. You know the risks, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course I do. But once severe Overclocking symptoms appear, they can't be cured, can they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I'm happy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been a blast competing and taking down those Tacet Discords with you... That's all I need to have a good time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If one day I die from Overclocking, so be it! The Black Shores will make sure there's no Tacet Field generated from me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've always followed my instincts, ignored anything that didn't interest me. No regrets, even if I died now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carpe diem, enjoy the moment… Life is boring if you're stuck in the past or consumed by the future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, what have you found? I got a stack of damaged photos. To locate that Stellar Matrix, we'll need three or four items tops.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The remaining frequencies... Yes, it belongs to Lady Flora.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been almost 20 years since the last frequencies were recorded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blake Blooms represent a Bloom Bearer's identity. They always have one on them. These frequencies can help us track Lady Flora's last activity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She and the leader of Black Shores vanished at the same time, no longer appearing in records.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Around the same time? The two cases might be connected...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right. I just remembered what that strange feeling I had earlier was.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I saw you in Jinzhou... It felt as if I'd seen you somewhere else before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, have you told Beatrice that we're ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How impressive, {PlayerName}! That's fast!

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please head to the Modulation Hall. I'll meet you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Camellya shows signs of Overclocking from battle, yet she appears unconcerned. She is accustomed to enduring pain and explains that savoring each present moment is her way of coping.

From the Blake Bloom's frequency, you discover that Lady Flora disappeared around the same time as the Black Shores leader. With enough items gathered, you head to the Modulation Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, please give me the things you just found… Oh, you want to come along, Camellya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName} begged me to go with {Male=him;Female=her}, and it looked fun, so I agreed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that's rare. The Camellya I know was only interested in going out to find candidates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, kudos to you for being able to get her to cooperate with you. Awesome.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, normally, Camellya doesn't seem to care about anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, that's quite a confident statement, but you do have the skills to back it up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With Camellya on this mission with you, you should be safer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I'll be keeping a close eye on you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hand the three items to Beatrice. She records the information and then returns them to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on. I need some time to process the data. Once that's done, you can dive into the Stellar Matrix with our portal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Past, present, future… All the possibilities in the universe change within this swirling starry sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm starting to get a bit interested~! What kind of "me" is hidden in there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, {PlayerName}. A new adventure awaits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After Beatrice completes the modulation, you and Camellya dive into the stars to locate the escaped Stellar Matrix.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see… (static)… something… deep…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll catch… then meet me…

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Static)… what happened… {PlayerName}…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The communication cut out. Something must've happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got separated from Camellya… I should check out the surroundings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've sealed my memories, letting the past fade into nothingness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Did I make the right choice?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But {PlayerName} already made {Male=his;Female=her} choice. Now I must make my own choice, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... I'd rather die than live as a useless nobody.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that Camellya? No…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm inside a Stellar Matrix that holds Lady Flora's information, so it must be a simulation of some past event.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
During the dive, something goes wrong. You lose contact with Camellya and the Modulation Hall.

On the other side of the Stargate, you find yourself in a strange cave. There, an illusion of Lady Flora, resembling Camellya, appears before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A part of a broken stone, hidden under the dense veins, faintly reveals itself, bearing some chiseled marks.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It reads… "Petalfall Village".

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Veins are everywhere. Overly dense. The plants here are abnormal.

Chapters.Title: Whispers of Lady Flora drift from somewhere up ahead

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many years have passed, and here I am again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm not gonna stay at the Black Shores and live off old memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh! My body's giving out... Hah... Need a place to rest soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya's illusion disappeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since she mentioned "sealed her memories" and "returned", this must be the cave from twenty years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did Camellya seal her memories because of my choice?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …(Static)… {PlayerName}, can you hear me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something's not right. I'll get you out of the Stellar Matrix first!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The surroundings turn dark, and you feel yourself being lifted out of the Stellar Matrix. You open your eyes, and find yourself back to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You learn that Lady Flora sealed her memories because of a choice your past self made. Bewildered, you return to the Modulation Hall with Beatrice's help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I'm sorry. That matrix is more cunning than we anticipated… My mistake.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know where she is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya is still inside that Stellar Matrix.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was trapped inside and started to sink deeper—that's why you couldn't go any further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, Camellya has found the matrix core. Without her, it might have escaped again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, we'll create a symmetrical Stellar Matrix, and that will allow you to reach the previously inaccessible areas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There will be various simulated areas. To reach the destination, you need to find and jump to the correct timeline junctures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Due to a mutated Stellar Matrix, you may not reach the destination in one go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Multiple jumps might be required to get there. {PlayerName}, please stay safe!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beatrice informs you that Camellya is still trapped in the Stellar Matrix. To rescue her, you must enter the Matrix once again. Beatrice warns you that multiple jumps might be needed to reach the correct timeline juncture.

Chapters.Title: Dive into the stars and retrieve the corrupted Stellar Matrix

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (KU-Riri is pacing back and forth, seemingly eager to say something.)

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master, the Overclocked Resonator known as "Lady Flora" has breached containment and left her medical pod.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The target is currently located in… located…

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target is in the room ahead. Your need to calm her down and transfer her back to the medical pod.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Lady Flora" is dangerous—her mind and language skills are impaired, making her prone to reckless behavior. She is a threat to the Black Shores' internal facilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the other residents of Petalfall Village, we have confirmed that they have all perished.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We couldn't save them in time. The situation worsened too quickly after we received the unusual signal until you arrived.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The previous recording mentioned a few survivors from the Tacet Discord Outbreak, but in this Petalfall Village, everyone perished except for Camellya.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The situation here seems to differ from my timeline.)

Options.PlotLineKey: When did I bring Lady Flora back to the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Two weeks ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master, master, m-master...

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please calm her down as soon as possible. Prolonged Overclocking will put greater strain on her body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Riri turns and looks at the door a short distance away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon crossing the Stargate, you find yourself in a simulated Black Shores from many years ago. There, you encounter a nervous robot, KU-Riri, who tells you that Lady Flora is Overclocking and has fled her medical pod to hide in a nearby room. This suggests you are not in the correct juncture, but rather a distorted version of history.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's locked... So Camellya, in her Overclocked state, damaged the locked door's security system, when her mind was unclear?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to restore the security system first.

Chapters.Title: Destroy the vines sealing the gate

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mutated plants have grown so large… Camellya in this timeline has severely Overclocked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cracked bricks line the room, where massive vines coil through the space, their roots plunging deep into the walls and floor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you observe more closely, you notice the vines subtly pulsating, as if they were veins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Debris and broken equipment are scattered across the floor, the aftermath of uncontrolled chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unlike the composed Camellya you once met in Jinzhou, her current, uncontrolled state has left her struggling to manage her Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A malfunctioning screen flickers, displaying a log of recent visitors to the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the data, you discover that Lady Flora was brought here only recently, and her condition has deteriorated rapidly over the past days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Restraints… I… AHHHHHH!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Voices… so many noises…!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It... hurts...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm taking you back to the medical pod.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My head… My whole body... hurts...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Petalfall Village…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see… Ah, it's over…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You… defeated… me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I seem to… have seen you… much earlier…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This… is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find Lady Flora covered in vines, struggling against her Overclocking. As her condition eases, she gazes at you with a faint smile and offers you a flower.

Chapters.Title: Jump to the next timeline juncture

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya disappeared… So, does that gate lead to a new juncture?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Flora once Overclocked so much that her mind was heavily damaged, and her language abilities degenerated… Then, the Camellya I know…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm... back on the surface of the Black Shores island?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I should go look around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A notebook, a stack of photographs, and a portable water bottle are strewn on the ground. The warmth of the water suggests the owner left only moments ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The photos depict various landscapes of the Black Shores, indicating the owner's passion for photography. To your surprise, one of the photos is a candid shot of your own silhouette.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is odd... Where could they be hiding...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, a group of newcomers arrived today, but I just got word that there's one more than what was on the list.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Consultant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're not sure if someone slipped in unnoticed, so we're doing a full sweep of the area.

Chapters.Title: Talk to the Black Shores Gardener

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's really you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heard I can find the Black Shores here. Glad I didn't come to the wrong place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm Camellya. Or call me "Lady Flora" if you want. People from Petalfall Village like to call me that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You left in such a hurry. We didn't even get a chance to talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I felt... off, like I missed out on something important, so I came here alone to find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's the situation in Petalfall Village?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The injured have been transferred to other nearby villages. Most of the villagers are safe and sound, thanks to your timely rescue.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Most of the villagers are safe… and with the way Camellya looks now… It seems I'm in an alternate timeline again.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But even if the history is changed, we still met each other.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the Black Shores leader, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I snuck in here, but please don't drive me out! I have my own Forte now! I can work for you.

Options.PlotLineKey: Now? You mean you couldn't before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… don't know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those Consultants said my Rabelle's Test showed I awakened my Forte. But in the village, I didn't feel anything special.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: … And I don't remember anything before coming to the village.

Options.PlotLineKey: You have lost your memory before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, villagers said I appeared in the woods by their lake one autumn morning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's all I remember. Didn't have anywhere else to go, so I stayed in that village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can I stay with you here? At the Black Shores? I-I want to serve you. Make me your Bloom Bearer.

Options.PlotLineKey: Technically speaking, it's a job, and you'll be serving the entire Black Shores.
And Camellya, you are not "mine". You belong to yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Join us if you pass the assessment. The Black Shores welcomes those who protect the world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great! But... I-I still don't know your name. Tell me, please?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... It's a beautiful name. I'll never forget it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm so happy, really, really happy that my vines feel so light…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How strange... This is our first formal conversation, but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It feels like I had heard your name before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, this is my Forte. I quite like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to shadow you, see how a strong person like you moves forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This flower... is for you. I'm looking forward to the days ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Crossing the Stargate again, you meet another version of Lady Flora at the Black Shores. Unlike the previous Lady Flora, she appears healthy and slightly bashful, yet her admiration for you remains unchanged. She mentions that meeting you feels familiar.

Thanks to your timely arrival, Petalfall Village has survived the disaster in this juncture, even though that is not how it truly happened. Like she did before, Lady Flora smiles and offers you a flower.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Tacet Discords… The Stellar Matrix must've noticed us. It's trying to hold me back.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya is trapped deep inside... She must be in danger now. I need to find the correct juncture fast.

Chapters.Title: Jump to the next timeline juncture

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? It's you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Done with the work? You should get some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been super well-behaved these past few days! Did everything as you said! Didn't cause any trouble or go to places I shouldn't!

Dialogues.Speaker: KU-Riri
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: KU-Riri reporting in! The infrastructure damage in Petalfall Village is severe. The rebuilding will be difficult in the short term, and it requires reassessment…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You need some discipline, robot. How dare you interrupt my conversation with {Male=him;Female=her}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You wanna know the situation in Petalfall Village? I can tell you. I was there, remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's been… a few months since the Tacet Discords attacked the village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I turned into a flower tree due to Overclocking and trapped those feeble creatures in an underground cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (KU-Riri's recording mentioned that Camellya was found in an underground cave. Looks like this time, I jumped to the right juncture.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I threw them out of the village when I started transforming. They would have died if they stayed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not many survived, but some did. They managed to hold on until you showed up, and they guided you to find me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a surprise. Thought they'd run away when I threw them out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have no interest in those crybabies… but since they took me in for a while, I owed them a favor.

Options.PlotLineKey: It felt good to do good, huh?
You don't need to find an excuse for your good deed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! That's a cute way to put it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? I'm speaking from my heart. I don't wanna spare a glance at those weaklings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I despise weaklings. Myself included. I was a sorry sap when I turned into that plant!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you saved me. You pulled me out of Overclocking and brought me back to sanity. I should thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't remember anything before I arrived in that village. I don't care anyway. You're the only one who's ever made me feel so excited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, how about making me your Bloom Bearer? You see... who else can keep me from causing trouble elsewhere?

Options.PlotLineKey: …Well, indeed I can't just let you leave.
You would be a risk to public safety, no doubt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right? Making me yours exactly aligns with the interests of Solaris, and as you just said, would make the world a safer place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just so you know, when I was doing the Rabelle test, the staff said I'm still prone to Overclocking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I may have great power now, but I might lose it or fall prey to my emotions again someday.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that day comes, then… I'll embrace it as my destiny! Fate's already brought us together, and I'll pay any cost for that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's led me to the most exquisite flower in this world. I'll give anything for it, no hesitation!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you know? Climbing plants are obsessed with big, gorgeous trees. Clinging onto them like their life depends on it, sucking up all the energy they can get from the sun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're driven by an insatiable hunger to savor their beloved tree, down to the last bit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After passing through the Stargate for the third time, you finally reach the correct timeline juncture.

The Lady Flora you meet resembles Camellya in the real world and, like the others, she does not hide her feelings for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, we'll have plenty of time together. You can definitely, rigorously... train me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This flower is for you, to express my…

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the correct timeline juncture. Initiating jump now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, this little troublemaker is clever, having set all these traps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now its core is cornered here, it can't run any further. I can handle it easily when I find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a pity I got separated from {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish {Male=he;Female=she} could see what I just saw in those alternative timelines. Can't wait to see {Male=his;Female=her} reactions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I hadn't returned to the Black Shores and become a Bloom Bearer again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was still possible for us to reunite! I saw it! Whether as a wandering traveler or a Fractsidus member, I got to meet {Male=him;Female=her} anyway!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've sealed my memories, letting the past fade into nothingness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Did I make the right choice?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that… me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They said this matrix contains Lady Flora's information, so… this must be something "I" had experienced in the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sealed memories and this cave… this is where I first awoke.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like this is what Lady Flora last saw before she decided to seal her memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But {PlayerName} already made {Male=his;Female=her} choice. Now I must make my own choice, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... I'd rather die than live as a useless nobody.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …{PlayerName}? So I knew {Male=him;Female=her} before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! That's it! {Male=He;Female=She}'s a magnet for all kinds of fun. Now let's see what else we can stir up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After losing contact with you, Camellya crosses the Stargate and finds herself in the cave from the past. Like you, she has jumped through many simulated worlds and witnessed different possibilities, but her path always crosses with yours.

Intrigued by the Lady Flora illusion in front of her, Camellya decides to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess I'd better not use my Forte, or I'd be at a disadvantage when {PlayerName} catches up later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it a flower seed on the base?

Chapters.Title: Use the flower seed to open the door

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, as I expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, want to stand in my way? Get lost!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A flower seed should do the trick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, the patterns are lighting up. Now I can rotate the platform.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is the correct path to take.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Not long ago.
In the corrupted Stellar Matrix, Camellya has already passed through three Stargates, witnessing the possibilities of several different worlds before arriving in an underground cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That flower is craving a flower seed. Guess I should place a seed there to unlock the gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The flower seed has unveiled the hidden path. Hehe, this space seems to defy its creator's will to aid me.

Chapters.Title: Use the flower seed to open the door

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Flora's illusion is ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this is indeed the final moments before you sealed your memories, let me find out the reasons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me see why you made that choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all these years, {Male=he;Female=she} still made that choice…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never asked {Male=him;Female=her} much about the Black Shores or {Male=his;Female=her} past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't care. As long as we were both happy when we crossed blades, I was happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, {PlayerName} wants to leave… and even abandon {Male=his;Female=her} memories?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doing all of this for what? A so-called better outcome?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, for the Black Shores, a better future must mean saving Solaris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't care about that at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Why do I have to lose my only beloved playmate, my most cherished opponent!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Flora explains that the past duties imposed on the one she yearns for led to their decision to leave the Black Shores. Camellya listens to her past self, surprised by her depth of emotion. Through Lady Flora's words, Camellya realizes that you are the leader of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here at the Black Shores, {Male=he;Female=she}'s the most trapped one... by far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, is this an illusion from the past? Looks like I used to be quite… sentimental.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though I had this guess while in the previous junctures—{PlayerName} was indeed the former Black Shores leader.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My Rabelle Index has worsened. The doctors and the Shorekeeper said I need a rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hmph. They mean well, but… I know myself better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rest won't help… I've lost my anchor. {Male=He;Female=She}'s no longer here to rein me in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've started remembering things from before I came to Petalfall Village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, was our encounter there a gift from fate… or a curse?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, thinking about the past will only make my Overclocking worse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName} is gone. I can choose to wait, but will {Male=he;Female=she} really return?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if… I'm already dead by then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Flora's condition has gradually worsened ever since she lost her Anchor. As memories from before her arrival at Petalfall Village resurface, her Overlocking symptoms intensify. Camellya struggles to understand what it means to care about others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if I never see {Male=him;Female=her} again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dead is dead. It means the end. There's no point in imagining all this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fearing loneliness and death…? These emotions are so unfamiliar… so strange.

Chapters.Title: Pick up the flower seed and unveil the path
Rotate the platform to form a new path
Use the flower seed to open the door

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened? My chest feels so tight, and I feel… a little unwell?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must be affected by the environment. My body and emotions are…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Stellar Matrix is starting to fight back. I'd better hurry up and take it down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even with treatment, I'll barely be able to maintain my current state.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But constant Overclocking and forced corrections will ruin me in the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can feel my energy and power draining away, day by day...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if {PlayerName} one day returns, what will I be able to do for {Male=him;Female=her}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trapped in my body, needing {Male=his;Female=her} pity for love and attention...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that's how I'll end up, I'd rather die on the spot!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will never… become a pitiful… weakling... like that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Flora refuses treatment, fearing it will leave her with nothing. Without her power, she would feel forever inferior to the one she cherishes, a fate she cannot accept. The heavy atmosphere triggers Camellya's own Overclocking symptoms to flare up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, my body... It's acting up again... Is it the surroundings?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! Why am I always held back by Overclocking... Dammit...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …It's time to go. To where I met {PlayerName}. It will be closure for me, for this cherished connection.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll leave the bracelet {Male=he;Female=she} gave me here in the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't just sit here and rot away, clinging to old memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is... another way, to keep Overclocking from eating me inside out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A way to control my emotions... Stop the past from haunting me. A way to forget it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will abandon my memories like {PlayerName} once did, sealing them away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sanity is a gift from {Male=him;Female=her}. I would not give it up that easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am one and the same with my instincts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like flowers thirst for water, and beasts hunger for flesh…

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
To put an end to her severe Overclocking, Lady Flora decides to abandon her memories, including all those of you. She believes that her connection to you is intrinsic to her nature and will ultimately guide her back to you. When that day arrives, she hopes to stand as their equal.

Watching her past self, Camellya acknowledges and accepts this choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With or without my memories, my instincts will still guide me to {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When we meet again, I hope {Male=he;Female=she} remains my worthy opponent. Friends or foes, united and unbound... It's a dream come true!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, indeed, that's the choice I would make.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cough… I will bloom to my fullest... follow my desires… till the end of it all.

Chapters.Title: Use the flower seed to find the path forward
Use the flower seed to open the door

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I... can't see the road ahead…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One more step… I can't... die here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Huff... Ugh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I passed the Bloom Bearer test!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take me with you next time, please?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll try my best to control myself for you, dear master.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lady Flora
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll abandon all memories and start over? Where are you going?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh… Having been there so many times...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought I was used to Overclocking...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that talk about power, about being free...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now? You're just a loser.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Shut up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How pathetic. Everything will be forgotten anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is the point?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do YOU know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You… will never be {Male=his;Female=her} equal. Ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forget and be forgotten...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I traveled far and wide in our time apart. Fate led me back to you every time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once I was a nameless traveler, passing you right by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once I joined the Fractsidus, and we met in battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I may forget you, again and again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as long as I still have my instincts…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll always gravitate towards you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll find me at the end of it all!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How pathetic. Everything will be forgotten anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is the point?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do YOU know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You… will never be {Male=his;Female=her} equal. Ever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forget and be forgotten...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I traveled far and wide in our time apart. Fate led me back to you every time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once I was a nameless traveler, passing you right by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once I joined the Fractsidus, and we met in battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I may forget you, again and again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But as long as I still have my instincts…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll always gravitate towards you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll find me at the end of it all!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha, come be my prey, sweet little birdie!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya's Alter Ego
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Consume and be consumed by power... What's wrong with that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I have no plan to drown here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's crush this pesky creature together!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah… Fighting by your side feels sooo good. My heart, my pulse, my frequencies—the vibrations are driving me crazy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such weaklings. I haven't had enough fun yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya smiles weakly before joyfully recounting what happened in the Stellar Matrix.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, {PlayerName}, where did you go after that? How did you find this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You saw those possible iterations of history too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe… So you really were the leader of Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wonder I felt something familiar when I first saw you outside Jinzhou…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah... Welcome back, {PlayerName}. Glad to see you again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I saw a lot of interesting stuff… I woke up in that cave a decade ago. Traveled all across Solaris before I ended up back at the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The matrix showed me several different iterations of my past. Looks like even the smallest deviations can lead to entirely different outcomes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But one constant remained—you always saved me, and we always found each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our encounter is preordained in every future...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My beloved seed, my only… rival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you just helped me with my Overclocking… Hmph, I won't let it happen again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gotta make sure to show you my best!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Stellar Matrix should be temporarily deactivated since its core has been dealt with.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go back. Give the coordinates to Beatrice, and this mission will be over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... can I have the rest of your day?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you wanna do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, let me keep it a secret for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You find yourself reunited with Camellya. Considering the years apart, this reunion has been ten years in the making. In every world, you and she have met, parted, and reunited again. If this is your fate, Camellya embraces it willingly.

With the Stellar Matrix defeated, the two of you return home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome back! Glad to see you safely return. Thank you for your hard work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Stellar Matrix is no match for us. Easy peasy.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you received the coordinates?

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, thank you. Leave the rest to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Beatrice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, Camellya, Shorekeeper asked me to remind you. Please use the medical pod in good time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? My symptoms are already gone… Alright, I'll go later. She really worries too much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she helped keep my bracelet safe too. Heh, I owe her that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, shall we go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, let me think... To the surface. Veiled Rock, the starting point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Stellar Matrices back in order, Camellya invites you to Veiled Rock.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I found those photos, I made a decision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Photos are great for capturing memories. Take some photos of me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the past, others recorded us, but now we'll have to do it ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Consider it... a tangible keepsake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They last longer than our memories. A moment frozen in frame.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the Black Shores leader, a small task like this would be a piece of cake for you, I bet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya asks you to take a photo of this moment as a way to capture her current feelings.

Chapters.Title: Use your Camera to capture her

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, stay focused. Don't take your eyes off me!

Chapters.Title: Use your Camera to capture her

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks good. I wanna keep a copy of this too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent composition. Quite the photographer, aren't you? Hehe…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, do you still have that bracelet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. You can keep it, so... a piece of me always stays with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since the past between us is a secret now, consider this bracelet our witness.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What exactly is this bracelet…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, it's an old one. It was… a gift.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it for monitoring my Rabelle spectrum, as an Overclocking warning device.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I don't really need it anymore. Told you I'll never lose control again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Except in a special situation like this, in most cases, nothing can even leave a scratch on me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hit jackpot finding the matrix. It was a blast! But that's all in the past now.

Options.PlotLineKey: You aren't going to get your memories back?
You said your memories are sealed by Lady Flora…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm quite happy with things as they are right now. No need to risk opening the floodgates and winding up in another medical pod.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since Lady Flora—the past me—chose to seal away those memories, I'm fully behind my decision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the memories we used to share, if fate decides to reveal them, they'll resurface naturally as we continue our journey together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus… does it really matter? No, it doesn't!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate has already brought us back together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I bet we'll have more wild stories to share, and more games to play.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No point dwelling on the past. I'd rather live in the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Speaking of which, I have a question for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}… Are you happy now? Having lost all memories, living a new life...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? Good to know. I'm happy too. Every moment <ano=Sparring>dancing</ano> with you brings me immense joy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... If one day you get tired of all this saving-the-world stuff, I'll whisk you away to a place where no one can find us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, same here. But you'll be fine, because you have me now. We can take our time figuring out this life, together!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where I first set foot on this island, where everything began. The stars lie beneath our feet, where the Tethys System resides.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tethys records all data on Solaris, capturing countless possibilities born and fading away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in every possible scenario, we always find each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All paths in the stars converge towards this single endpoint, so—

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The universes where we didn't meet must have all perished! Only this one survived!

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the universe were a flower, then yes…

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...This must be the perfect world for a gardener like me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Once trapped in a labyrinth of memories and possibilities, Camellya has lost much. But now, she tells you she no longer wishes to recover her lost memories, believing the seal left by Lady Flora will naturally break when the time is right.

What matters to her now is enjoying this reunion with you.

Just as she did in previous timeline junctures, Camellya smiles and extends her hand, offering you a flower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the breeze here... It feels so perfect against my skin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waves crashing, the light shimmering on the water's surface...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, don't you think? Maybe we used to sit here like this, together...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeling the wind, watching the night unfold before us, again and again...
